docs.snippet: The literary publication has ventured for the first time outside the Anglophone realm, to the Western world's second most widely spoken language.
docs.lead_paragraph: Through its periodic lists of the best young novelists, the British literary magazine Granta has built a reputation for spotting and promoting emerging talents long before they become widely known. A 1983 list of British writers included Martin Amis, Julian Barnes, William Boyd, Ian McEwan, Salman Rushdie, and Graham Swift, while a similar inventory of American writers in 1996 drew attention to Sherman Alexie, Madison Smartt Bell, Edwidge Danticat, Jonathan Franzen and Lorrie Moore.
docs.abstract: The literary publication has ventured for the first time outside the Anglophone realm, to the Western world's second most widely spoken language.

docs.snippet: The hard-tackling midfielder Nigel de Jong was dropped from the Dutch national team for two Euro 2012 qualifiers by Coach Bert van Marwijk after his tackle resulted in an opposing player breaking his leg in an English Premier League game over the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The hard-tackling midfielder Nigel de Jong was dropped Monday from the Dutch national team for two Euro 2012 qualifiers (against Moldova and Sweden) by Coach Bert van Marwijk after his tackle resulted in an opposing player breaking his leg in an English Premier League game over the weekend.
docs.abstract: The hard-tackling midfielder Nigel de Jong was dropped from the Dutch national team for two Euro 2012 qualifiers by Coach Bert van Marwijk after his tackle resulted in an opposing player breaking his leg in an English Premier League game over the weekend.

docs.snippet: The Lede provided updates on the rescue of 33 Chilean miners whose entrapment in a collapsed mine shaft ended after 69 days.
docs.lead_paragraph: On Tuesday and Wednesday, The Lede provided updates in real time on the final stage of the rescue of 33 Chilean miners whose entrapment in a collapsed mine shaft ended after 69 days. The live coverage included a video feed from the mine (now concluded) and reports from our colleagues Simon Romero and Alexei Barrionuevo, who were at the San José mine, near the Chilean city of Copiapó, along with family members of the miners and more than 1,400 journalists. To follow the rescue as it unfolded, read up the page below.
docs.abstract: The Lede provided updates on the rescue of 33 Chilean miners whose entrapment in a collapsed mine shaft ended after 69 days.

headline.main: Latest Updates on the Rescue of the Chilean Miners
